meanings.sent1: The movie was full of shmaltzes, making everyone cry.
meanings.sent2: Her speech was filled with shmaltzes, touching everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The play was so full of shmaltzes that even the actors couldn't help but shed a tear.
meanings.sent4: The novel's ending was a perfect example of shmaltzes, leaving readers emotional.
meanings.sent5: The song's lyrics were drenched in shmaltzes, resonating with listeners.

meanings.sent1: He couldn't resist the shmaltzes from his boss, always praising his work.
meanings.sent2: Her friends showered her with shmaltzes on her birthday, making her feel special.
meanings.sent3: The salesman's shmaltzes were so over-the-top that no one believed him.
meanings.sent4: The politician's speech was filled with shmaltzes, trying to win over the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's constant shmaltzes towards the students boosted their confidence.

meanings.definition: To cook or fry in fat or grease.
meanings.sent1: She shmaltzes the latkes until they are golden brown and crispy.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully shmaltzes the chicken in hot oil for a delicious meal.
meanings.sent3: He always shmaltzes his vegetables in butter for extra flavor.
meanings.sent4: The aroma of the onions being shmaltzed in the pan filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the meat being shmaltzed on the grill was mouthwatering.
